alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 1:47PM CDT until May 30 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Fulton, Horton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs at the gage site. Low lying areas along Route D near Stotesbury flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 43.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM CDT Saturday was 44.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 32.8 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 200 PM CDT.
